items.title: This already-affordable 27-inch QHD 180Hz ASRock Phantom gaming monitor is now even lower at $143
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Newegg that drops ASRock’s 27-inch Phantom Gaming QHD monitor down to $142.77 shipped. This is an already affordable display that typically fetches $210, but it’s available for even less right now at 32% off. Today’s deal shaves $67 off its usual going rate, marking the lowest price we’ve seen for this model. While Amazon has some third-party listings floating around at $176 with mixed reviews, Newegg’s deal is the one to go for if you want to lock in the best price. The FHD variant of this monitor is also discounted to $95 right now at Newegg. Head below for more details.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Ultimate price hikes are here, load your account up at the now discounted rate while you can
items.summary:
We are once again going to be doing something little bit different for today’s game post. Microsoft just announced sweeping changes to Xbox Game Pass – some good, some not so much – and one thing you’ll notice from our coverage is that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate is going up from $19.99 a month to $29.99 a month. Now might be a good time to load up your account and you can do so on Amazon where you will still find 1-month subs/extensions down at $19.99 and 3-months options at $59.99 a month. You can alternatively score 3-months of PC Game Pass at $35.99, which converts to 2-months of Ultimate (that’s $18 per month). There’s no telling how much longer this will work, or how much longer pricing will remain at $20/month via proper retailers – jump in while you can. There are some slightly sketchy sites out there with lower prices still, but many of them end up being more hassle than not much of the time. 

Xbox Game Pass is getting a major revamp, a major price hike, and some major upgrades

more…

items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops one of the latest Alienware Aurora gaming PCs with an RTX 5070 GPU down to $1,729.99 shipped. This particular config with an Intel Core Ultra 7 265KF processor, 32GB RAM, and 2TB SSD, typically goes for $2,400, so you’re looking at a solid $670 discount. You can even configure the same specification directly at Dell to lock in this price. Another variant of this PC with an Ultra 7 265F processor and 1TB SSD instead of 2TB can be had for $1,549.99 shipped, which is again a pretty good price for the kind of hardware it brings to the table. items.title: SteelSeries’ rarely discounted Arctis GameBuds just hit a new all-time low at $128
items.summary:
While you can still grab SteelSeries’ Arctis Pro Wireless gaming headset for $140, we just spotted another deal that gets you the brand’s Arctis wireless earbuds at a solid price. Amazon is offering SteelSeries’ Arctis GameBuds for $127.99 shipped. These earbuds originally launched last year at $160 and have gone for as high as $200 on Amazon in recent months. Today’s deal takes a full 36% off, saving you $72 and setting a new all-time low. These earbuds have mostly been fetching their full price since debut, and they’ve only seen one other notable discount before, when they dropped to $148 earlier this year. Best Buy still has them marked at $172, so be sure to cash in on Amazon’s deal to lock in the best price.

Marsail 48- by 28-inch Electric Standing Desk

Buy for $80 (Reg. $150)

What we love

If your desk has seen better days or if you’re just starting to build out your office, this is a solid price point to cash in on for a standing desk. Generally speaking a 48-inch surface is a common width for an entry-level standing desk, but where this desk differs is in its depth, which spans 28 inches. That tacks on an addition 4 inches which can be helpful if you want to use a larger display and not be right up against it.
